isis.stitle: VT 365 Diesel Engine - 2004 Model Year - ELECTRONICALLY CONTROLLED VARIABLE GEOMETRY TURBOCHARGER (VGT) - Cleaning and Inspection - Inspection

note.para: Replace VGT if blades are bent. Do not straighten bent wheel blades.

step1.para: Inspect the compressor impeller and turbine wheel for blade erosion, bending, breakage or deposits. Replace VGT if damaged.

note.para: Compressor impeller and turbine wheel deposits can be caused by the following:

item.para: High air inlet restriction allows oil to transfer from the VGT center housing, resulting in oil deposits.
Excessive oil consumption can result in turbine wheel carbon deposits.
Engine over fueling can cause excessive operating temperatures, which can melt aluminum parts. Deposits on the turbine wheel indicate failure.
Oil from crankcase breather (mounted on top of the left valve cover). Oil from the breather is normal for this engine.

step1.para: Inspect the turbine and compressor housings for wheel rubbing. Replace the VGT if wheels rub.
Inspect oil drain and supply lines for kinking, clogging, restrictions, and deterioration. Discard both sets of O-rings.
